update.description:
This potentially resolves [ign-gazebo issue #2](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/2/transport-segfault-on-shutdown). 

This is pull request is ready. 

I should note that I couldn't figure out how to write a test to capture the failure seen in ign-gazebo on shutdown.
update.title: Resolving ign-gazebo issue 2

content.raw: This fixes the `ign-gazebo` issue for me :thumbsup:
content.html: This fixes the ign-gazebo issue for me

By the way, did you try this with `ign-gazebo`, and if so did `ign-gazebo` exit cleanly?

content.raw: Totally harmless. I leave it up to you, but I'm always more inclined to remove any unused code \(in this case, the member variable and the `WorkerPool` class\). Additionally, this class is a copy from Ignition Common. I’m approving in any case.
content.html: Totally harmless. I leave it up to you, but I'm always more inclined to remove any unused code (in this case, the member variable and the WorkerPool class). Additionally, this class is a copy from Ignition Common. I’m approving in any case.

content.raw: Yes, we could. I left it there in case we need/want to go back to it. I don't think it harmful to leave it in, right?
content.html: Yes, we could. I left it there in case we need/want to go back to it. I don't think it harmful to leave it in, right?

content.raw: I think that the `WorkerPool` class is not needed anymore. We could remove `WorkerPool.hh` and `WorkerPool.cc`.
content.html: I think that the WorkerPool class is not needed anymore. We could remove WorkerPool.hh and WorkerPool.cc.

content.raw: I tweaked the Windows warnings suppression a little bit in [866ad07](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/866ad070d3990a99d910c3f9f4daa88c86185175?at=gz11).
content.html: I tweaked the Windows warnings suppression a little bit in 866ad07.
